sysUtils

Class FileSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • sysUtils.FileSystem

  • public final class FileSystem
extends java.lang.Object
    The FileSystem class is used by the application to store and load files in the application directory, this way, the user doesn't need to tell it where to locate some files.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String APP_FOLDER

      static java.lang.String LOG_FOLDER

      static java.lang.String TOKENS_FOLDER 
      static java.lang.String USER_HOME 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      static FileSystem getInstance()
      Use this method to gain access to the various application folder methods.
      void init()
      Call this method at the start of the application to ensure all the folders it needs are created.
      java.lang.String saveLog()
      Saves the contents of the Logger to the logs directory, with the current date appended to the end of the file name.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static final FileSystem getInstance()
        Use this method to gain access to the various application folder methods.
        Returns:
        the FileSystem interface used by the application.

      • init

        public final void init()
                throws java.io.IOException
        Call this method at the start of the application to ensure all the folders it needs are created.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the folders cannot be created, nor do they exist. At this point, this is considered a fatal error for the application, and it should quit.

      • saveProperties

        public java.lang.String saveProperties(java.lang.String name,
                                       GoogleSheetProperties props)
                                throws java.io.IOException
        Saves some GoogleSheetProperties to the props folder.
        Parameters:
        name - the name to give the property file.
        props - the GoogleSheetProperties to save.
        Returns:
        the path to the file the properties were saved to
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the props fail to save.

      • saveLog

        public final java.lang.String saveLog()
                               throws java.io.IOException
        Saves the contents of the Logger to the logs directory, with the current date appended to the end of the file name.
        Returns:
        the path to the file the log was saved to
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if it fails to write the file.
